Like all of you, I looked up this place on Yelp before my family and i went.  I tried to set up a reservation by calling ahed of time.  The man I spoke with told me there was no reservations because they were fully booked.  He said it would be a 30-45 minute wait.  We decided to go anyways because we wanted to try paella for the first time in the best restaurant we could find.   When we arrived, we expected to see a full outer/inner dinning area, there wasn't anyone outside and only a few tables were taken inside.  Our 30-45 minute wait was only seconds, which was not too shabby.  I just don't appreciate being told one thing and arriving to find the complete opposite is the case.     After being seated at a white linen table by a man in a tuxedo and looking around, we quickly felt like we were under dressed.  All the servers were wearing tuxedos and the place felt very formal, however the other patrons had shorts and t-shirts on just like us.  My girlfriend and I wanted to split an order of (fish only) Rich man's Paella.  Which is enough for two people.  If your really hungry, you mite be able to handle the whole thing by yourself.  It was very delicious and full of flavor.  It had 1 VERY SMALL piece of lobster tail and a lot of squid, clams, and mussels.  I thought for being called "Rich Man's Paella" and being served by waiters in tuxedos, there would be a little more shellfish.  However, that was not the case.     All in all I thought the services was top notch as well as the flavor of the food.  just don't be afraid to ask your server what exactly is going to be included in your dish.
